Moved to proper category.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
It would definitely end up more than 1 emerald, but I like this idea.
You can get them from master librarians already. https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Name_Tag#Trading
não percebi nadaaaaa
Plz vote and use since successive you would use for this idea

I feel like this could be a great replacement for pumpkins, that doesn't obscure your vision!

Great idea!
Love the idea. You should spell correctly to make it easier to read.

I believe the stonecutter was introduced in 1.14 not only because it's a requirement for villager stone masons, but also because it allows people who played on the Bedrock edition to be more familiar with the user interface.  Similar to how the Java people can simply memorize each crafting recipe in a 3x3 grid.

Clear math XD.

I think it is useless too. Hope to delete it!
i agree
you can still craft with stone the way you could before, it stone-cutters just make it easier

I know I'm very late to this thread but I don't think it's useless. The stonemason is very good for farming ems and a stone cutter is a very fitting tool for a  mason to have. Plus, even though you can craft all of the things that stone cutters can cut stone into, stone cutters are at least semi-useful since they let you save materials. Idk about anyone else but it is pretty annoying when your one block short of being able to craft stairs so you just have 5 random blocks and you don't know what t do with them. and it can also be helpful for beginner s to mc as well.
He can play on creative mode and get to know building, or play on an old world, but interesting concept!
It should be any tamed animal actually.
Flying like that would be extremely op, and you can use rockets, just make a creeper farm

I agree that bows and crossbows are too similar as weapons, some of your solutions aren't very good, since they want to eliminate the strenghts of a crossbow: being able to ignore shields, aoe damage and fast fire rate
Moving the crossbow's enchantments to the bow will only worsen the problem and by making that crossbows unload when not held will ultimately kill their purpose

So your another person who noticed this as well. Do you also remember the 1.13 - 1.14 version of Minecraft bedrock edition. The feature stated into the Minecraft - Buzzy Bees - 1.14.0 (Bedrock), (news article) saying players can no longer initiated swimming in shallow water - (quote form Minecraft article Buzzy Bees). It was even placed into these two categories on the bug report website. The article: One Block Swimming, Swimming can be activated in shallow water (MCPE-38751), and the article: Swim Problem (MCPE-47261)

Please elaborate what a tock update would do, why it should be seperate from a tick update, and why you want it. Also, you might want to move this to the Gameplay category as this section is for already-implemented features.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.

I agree with you on this idea, and I think it is glorious. Cause the minecraft world is 60 million blocks in x and z coordinates, so each side would be 24494897 blocks long. But I dont think the world could be 100% a cube, because then it would look weird on the transition between one egde to the other.

Another neat idea added on to this, could be to replace the current world border with an atmosphere. Seperating a potential space dimension from the overworld. I think a logical height level for the atmosphere would be at 30 million blocks away from the core (0,0,0). Since 30 million is where the border stands in the x and z coordinates as of the day I am writing this.
Slow Falling Potions are and were already craftable.
Yes this is great as if I'm building I can have Haste without having to set up a beacon
You can do that with commands.

If it seems useless then make a little piramid of iron/gold/emerald/diamond 4 blocks tall the beacon as the top, give it an iron ingot and you can get any effwct you want (what can i saaay its just a featuuureeee♪♪♪)

My point isn't that the beacon is useless.  It's very useful!  But think of all the hours you have to spend in order to spawn the wither, kill it, AND get 1,000 emeralds/gold/diamonds/iron to make a fully powered beacon.

Is just getting a few status effects around your base really worth all that work?
The Zombie(and other Undead mobs) can still sense the player because its love for our flesh.
Good idea
The same thing for nausea but with mobs it's only cosmetic.
Think about improving fishing. Using fishing nets, fishing boats or something that can enhance in-game fishing.
I had the same idea bro :)
My idea was that you get  strenght and speed.That for about 30 seconds

I think this is an awesome idea!

 

Maybe there could be a sort of fairy/insect wing, and a hell/fire wing, to contrast with the angel wing!
I dunno about the dispenser part, but I like the rest.
I made the dipenser part so it wouldn’t ruin alot of people’s builds, I also did it so the dispenser can pick the water back up again.

Water and Lava source blocks should probably have gravity. Their respective materials already follow gravity, you have these very awkward floating source blocks, especially with something like TNT mining in the Nether where you're left with floating pillars of it that simultaneously falls but doesn't. The source blocks themselves should probably pathfind before they "settle" (like flowing liquid already does) to avoid liquid source blocks being able to be stacked on top of eachother in an unintuitive fashion. But this would also unlock new gameplay, as it would finally be possible to actually drain pools of water, and what's more is that it would make underground aquifers and such more dangerous to fool around with, adding some much needed interest to caving gameplay.
Maybe by water logging to stop gravity and Maybe make water source move with water flow only if its not waterlogged
It already does and the AFK fishing glitch was patched.
@RobotZap10000 Which version and/or platform are you talking about? I see people on last Java updates who do AFK fishing.
It must to be solved tis is a big problem in the community
I don't see how this is an issue, it's the only way I can afk by my farms in my minecraft realm.
Is there really a question on how to stop afk-fishing? How about the mojang team makes it so that fishing does NOT give any xp at all? BOOM! AFK fishing is no more
If you don't like it, don't do it.
I think it's just worth changing the interaction with the gates and fishing rods at the control level so that the long press simply does not work.
Well, I guess that is the cost for virtually what is immunity to damage.

At least in java edition, if you do "/gamerule doMobSpawning false", it will effectively give you this style of gameplay. Because there are two different systems of mob spawning, the one that is desabled by that gamerule, that just randomly plops down mobs while the player is around, and another that is not disabled, generating mobs alongside the terrain generation of new chunks.

Most regular friendly mobs will spawn, like cows, horses, sheep, bunnies, and also villagers will spawn in villages, in this way. Tho in flying around, testing just to be certain, there was a suspicious lack of dolphins and fish in mob form, nor squids, tho thankfully, turtles do indeed generate. Spawners work like normal, and drowned zombies will generate in the underwater structures as well as elder guardians, and the ender dragon.

 

Tho having the mob spawing gamerule set to false gives a mostly fully functioning survival experience, having all, not just most, friendly mobs, generate with the terrain, would be a wonderfull adition.
Up
How about you DIY?
Hey have you heard of multiplayer. they have a thing called factions its basically the same exact thing
Then just play older versions.

The least you could do is say the specific things you don't like.  Even if this was something they wanted to do (because seriously?!!) they wouldn't be able to know what you liked and didn't like.

Because MacchuPicchu is right, if you liked the older Minecraft, why did you update?

What I mean by this is that the game is getting more and more complex which surprisingly can make a game more boring and less of itself. Lets look at the game Agar.io. Most of us know of this game as it was extremely popular back in 2015 and 2016. I'm mentioning this game because it died because it changed too drastically from what it originally was. Search up old Agar.io, then search up new Agar.io and you will see what I mean by "how it drastically changed". Then look at how Minecraft changed from what it originally was. Then you will see what i mean by how complexity changed the game too much to the point that it wasn't the same Minecraft anymore.

I completely disagree, I love the new content and would get bored with the old game pretty fast. Back in my Pocket Edition days, it would take me a few weeks to own everything in the entire game. That's no longer possible.

Either way, there is no way the devs will take you seriously. Their vision for Minecraft is to make a game that is rich and deep and complex and worthy of being the second best-selling video game of all time. The old days had their charm, but these days Minecraft is objectively a better game. I honestly think you're experiencing nostalgia more than anything else.

Steve Block, this game has not "died". It has decreased in popularity since its heyday, but that's to be expected for a game that is almost ten years old, and is not a sign that the game is somehow bad now. Those of us still here quite enjoy all of the new content. Exactly what is it that you expect the devs to do for you?

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain what you're looking for?

"Too complex" is highly subjective, and as such, not exactly useful without specific details.

Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

MacchuPicchu is right. Minecraft better than it ever was. When I first got it, you couldn’t go to the nether, the end or even use redstone. But now we have all of that and a lot more better things, and you still haven’t explained what is so “complex” about minecraft. And even so, I doubt the developers would change it.
Just play older versions.
If you want classic Minecraft, just go ahead and play an older version. And if you wanted this in the first place, why did you update?

If you play Java, Minecraft has an application where you can play Minecraft back in 2009. Also, if we were to remove the complex updates, it actually makes the game less fun, because we have a lesser amount of variety.
Yes, because change is terrible.
That is true, but what's your point?  It just says that maps cover a large area that takes time to traverse.

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain what you're looking for? Thanks, it will help us express your idea to the team in an actionable way.

p.s. 
due to the fact that the texture on version 1.7.10 is preserved even if the thing is damaged it was possible to do things with damages that do NOT work if you try to craft something from them.
Now, there is no such possibility, since with damage the thing turns into a very very ugly cube.

While this is an interesting idea I would argue it is unnecessary. The drive to continue progressing is already provided by the fact that higher-tier pickaxes are not only faster, but are required to mine certain types of ores.

I agree with MacchuPicchu.  The reason to upgrade is already built into the game.  You can’t get gold, redstone, or diamonds with a stone pick.  You can’t get obsidian until you have a diamond pick.  Plus the mining speed for the more basic tools seems like a snail once you try the upgraded ones.

Hard grounds changes the way mining works

with this new mining ide, will make them change the whole thing with mining works, as how they change the wather and how that is now in the new update

How does it change how mining works?  In a way that will be interesting and fun, at least.  You have two people who say they don’t see how your suggestion would change things, based on the stated goals of the suggestion, and you reply by saying exactly what you already said in the same words.
Despite the other two comments, this could give mojang an excuse to make more pickaxe tiers
I really wanted to toggle my sprint because i don't like to W tap anymore... It's frustrating i can say
